definition: to wander off/to stray/to get lost
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: Nu Wa side cheering them for a while, slowly got separated.
sentences.chinese: 他們在女媧身旁歡呼雀躍了一陣，慢慢走散了。

sentences.english: In case someone become separated, please remember the last three car number number is 121.
sentences.chinese: 萬一有人走散，請記住車號最後三個數字是121。

sentences.english: As we joined the big crowd, I got separated from my friends.
sentences.chinese: 當我們加入一大羣人時，我和我的朋友走散了。

sentences.english: The shepherd went to search for some sheep that had strayed.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人去找走散的羊去了。

sentences.english: They got separated in the crowded theater.
sentences.chinese: 在擁擠的戲院裏他們走散了。

sentences.english: They two lost each other on the job fair.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩個在招聘會上走散啦。

sentences.english: The child wandered off and got lost.
sentences.chinese: 那個孩子走散後迷路了。

sentences.english: My friend and I got separated in the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友和我在人羣中走散了。

sentences.english: In some way, in the rush to get out of the building I got separated from my mother.
sentences.chinese: 我急急忙忙衝出大樓的時候不知怎麼就和媽媽走散了。
“我和媽媽走散了，”這個孩子說。

sentences.english: If she wanders away, he'll come find her IMMEDIATELY.
sentences.chinese: 如果女人不小心走散，他會立馬去把她找回來。

sentences.english: Have a designated meeting point and time if you get separated while hiking.
sentences.chinese: 指定一個匯合點和時間，以防你在徒步旅程中走散。

sentences.english: Develop an emergency communication plan in case family members are separated.
sentences.chinese: 制定當家庭成員走散後的緊急聯繫計劃。

definition: to lose touch with/missing/scattered/separated from
to wander off/to get lost
lost/missing/to lose (sb in one's charge)/to get lost/to wander away/to lose (flavor, freshness, shape, hair, one's good looks etc)/to lose meaning (in translation)
to lose the way/lost/labyrinth/labyrinthus vestibularis (of the inner ear)
to stay together (of a group)/to keep together
to lose
to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
to drift about/to wander/to roam/nomadic/homeless/unsettled (e.g. population)/vagrant
the way back/one's journey home
to go the same way
to be on one's own/to be left alone/to be left out
to meet together/to assemble
to meet
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
